title: Cardano High School Scholars Club for Underserved Areas
summary: In many underserved communities, students face  barriers to education, especially in emerging fields like blockchain technology , limiting their opportunities to participate in the digital economy.
solution: we will provide students with practical experience By integrating Cardano’s blockchain technology into the curriculum, equipe them with in-demand  and inspire them to pursue careers in blockchain
proposer_relevant_experience:
Project Lead : Sunday Dominic

Role: Oversee the entire project, coordinate between stakeholders, manage timelines, and ensure alignment with the project’s goals.

Curriculum Developer: Mautin Olayemi

Role: Design and refine the blockchain curriculum, ensuring it’s age-appropriate, engaging, and aligned with educational standards.

Community Engagement Coordinator: Ojo Christiana

Role: Build and maintain relationships with partner schools, organize events, and ensure active involvement of the community.

Blockchain Team lead: Fasonda James

Role: Provide technical expertise, support student projects, and ensure that the curriculum accurately reflects current blockchain trends and practices.

Evaluation Specialist: Sulaimon Fanimokun

Role: Design and implement assessment tools, analyze data on student performance, and produce impact reports.

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Who We’re Targeting:

We’re focusing on high school students in underserved communities, particularly in rural areas where access to quality STEM education and technology exposure is limited.



How We’ll Reach Them:

We’ll collaborate with local schools and education authorities, conduct in-person workshops during school hours, and leverage trained facilitators to ensure a hands-on, engaging learning experience.



Why This Matters for Cardano:

By introducing blockchain technology and the Cardano ecosystem to these students, we’re fostering early adoption and literacy, paving the way for a more inclusive and diverse blockchain community in the future. It also aligns with Cardano’s mission to drive positive social impact and education.

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Curriculum Development: Redesigning and refining the hands-on blockchain curriculum focused on Cardano for high school students.

Teacher Training: Conducting workshops and training sessions for educators to effectively deliver the curriculum.

In-Person Trainning: Organizing and facilitating 10 weeks hands-on blockchain workshops at partner schools to over 5000 high school students.

Student Projects: Encouraging students to work on real-world blockchain projects, such as building simple DApps or creating smart contracts.

Community Engagement: Hosting events and mentorship sessions to connect students with blockchain professionals.

Assessment and Feedback: Conducting evaluations to measure student progress and gather feedback for continuous improvement.

sub_fields.title: What are your success metrics?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Student Engagement: Measuring the number of students participating in the program and their level of involvement in activities and projects.

Knowledge Acquisition: Assessing improvements in students' understanding of blockchain concepts, through quizzes, tests, and projects.

Project Completion: Tracking the number of student projects completed, such as DApps or smart contracts, and their quality.

Teacher Feedback: Collecting feedback from educators on the effectiveness of the curriculum and training.

Community Impact: Evaluating the broader impact on the community, such as increased awareness and interest in technology careers.

Long-Term Outcomes: Monitoring the progression of students into further education or tech-related careers.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer: Our proposed solution, the Cardano High School Scholars Club, directly addresses the educational gap in underserved communities by providing a structured, hands-on blockchain curriculum. We leverage Cardano’s technology to teach students foundational concepts in blockchain, smart contracts, and decentralized applications. This immersive approach not only builds technical skills but also boosts confidence, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities. Ultimately, this solution empowers students, opens up new career pathways, and fosters long-term community growth in the tech sector.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer: The Cardano High School Scholars Club will have a far-reaching positive impact on the broader Cardano community by cultivating a new generation of blockchain-literate individuals. As over 5000 students gain hands-on experience, they become potential contributors, developers, and advocates for Cardano, driving innovation and adoption. This infusion of fresh talent and diverse perspectives will strengthen the Cardano ecosystem, foster community growth, and enhance the network’s reputation for education and inclusivity. Ultimately, this initiative will help build a robust pipeline of Cardano enthusiasts and innovators, propelling the ecosystem forward.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
12 Miles is a formally incorporated organization with a proven track record of delivering impactful technology education to underserved communities since 2020. Over the past three years, we have trained more than 11,000 students in STEM and digital skills. In 2025 alone, thanks to the support of Cardano Project 1300167, we trained over 5,000 students, directly reaching rural high schools. Our work has been recognized by local education authorities and even covered on TVC News [https://www\.youtube\.com/watch?v=v444Y5JKwTg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v444Y5JKwTg) , highlighting our credibility and the tangible impact of our programs.

We operate with transparency, accountability, and a structured approach. All our programs are carefully documented, with attendance sheets, student assessments, and facilitator reports ensuring clear records of participation and learning outcomes.

Validation of Approach

We validate the feasibility of our programs through:

Pilot Testing: Running small-scale programs in select schools to test curriculum, logistics, and student engagement.

Continuous Assessment: Using pre- and post-program evaluations to measure learning outcomes.

Stakeholder Feedback: Gathering input from students, teachers, and school administrators to refine delivery.

Public Recognition: Media coverage and endorsements from educational authorities further validate the effectiveness and credibility of our programs.

This combination of demonstrated experience, documented outcomes, and continuous feedback ensures that 12 Miles can deliver the proposed project with a high level of trust and accountability.

sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:

Signed onboarding confirmation from each participating school.



Facilitator training completed.



Assessment tools tested during a dry run.



Program timetable agreed upon with each school.

sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement

PDF package of curriculum + facilitator guide.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: In-Person Program Delivery Across Underserved High Schools

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
Full delivery of Cardano High School Scholars Club across the selected schools.



Weekly in-person teaching sessions covering blockchain basics, Cardano ecosystem, wallets, smart contracts, and DApp exploration.



Student participation in hands-on exercises (setting up wallets, interacting with testnet, simple smart contract logic).



Ongoing monitoring, attendance tracking, and classroom support.



Mid-program review to identify student challenges and adjust learning pace.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Minimum of 70% attendance rate across all participating schools.



At least 3–4 practical blockchain activities completed by students.



Facilitators follow weekly lesson plan structure.



Zero virtual sessions—100% in-person delivery.



Mid-program student feedback collected.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
Attendance sheets signed by teachers.



Photos/videos of classroom activities.



Weekly session reports submitted.



Mid-program feedback summary.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Cardano NEXTGEN  Tech Conference & Quizathon for High school

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
Successful Organization of the Conference



A fully in-person, one-day tech conference for secondary school students in underserved communities.



Includes keynote sessions, workshops, interactive tech demos, and student showcases.



Attendance of at least 800 students across 8-12 participating schools.



Quizathon Competition Execution



A competitive, team-based technology quiz (Quizathon) covering blockchain, robotics, AI, and 21st-century skills.



Top-performing students recognized with awards or certificates.



Event designed to encourage collaboration, problem-solving, and practical knowledge applicatio

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Conference successfully held within the scheduled date. 

Minimum student participation: at least 90% of registered students attend.

Quizathon executed with all schools represented, and at least 80% of students participate in at least one quiz round.

Positive feedback collected from students, teachers, and school administrators regarding engagement, learning, and experience.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
Official attendance register signed by students and school coordinators.



Conference program, event photos, and videos showing workshops, keynote sessions, and Quizathon rounds.



Quizathon results and certificates issued to winners and participants.



Feedback reports from students, teachers, and facilitators documenting learning outcomes and participant satisfaction.



Media coverage, press releases, or social media posts highlighting the event.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 1: Curriculum Development & School Onboarding – 15,000 ADA

Breakdown:

Curriculum Design & Development – 6,000 ADA

Creation of modules, slides, facilitator guide, worksheets, assessments

Pilot Testing & Review – 2,500 ADA

Dry-run with small student groups, external educator review

Facilitator Training – 3,500 ADA

Workshops for teacher/facilitator onboarding, stipends

School Onboarding & Coordination – 3,000 ADA

Engagement with schools, MoUs, scheduling, logistics

Milestone 2: Program Delivery & Student Engagement – 25,000 ADA

Breakdown:

In-Person Teaching Sessions – 12,000 ADA

Classroom delivery, teaching materials, equipment, facilitator stipends

Hands-on Student Activities – 6,000 ADA

Wallet setup, smart contracts, mini DApps, project materials

Monitoring & Evaluation – 4,000 ADA

Attendance tracking, mid-program assessment, feedback collection

Travel & Logistics – 3,000 ADA

Transport to schools, accommodation (if needed), daily operational costs

Milestone 3: Conference & Quizathon – 15,500 ADA

Breakdown:

Organizing the Conference – 6,000 ADA

Venue, setup, materials, event branding, logistics

Quizathon Prizes & Incentives – 5,000 ADA

Student awards, certificates, recognition items

Mentorship & Guest Speakers – 4,000 ADA

Inviting blockchain experts, facilitators, and keynote sessions

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The cost of the project presents significant value for the Cardano ecosystem by creating a sustainable pipeline of blockchain-literate students who can become future developers, innovators, and advocates for Cardano. By investing in high-quality education, we’re fostering long-term growth and adoption of Cardano technology, ensuring that the community is enriched with knowledgeable individuals who can drive innovation forward.



Additionally, the program helps bridge the digital divide by bringing cutting-edge blockchain education to underserved communities, thereby increasing Cardano’s reach and impact. The cost is effectively an investment in the ecosystem’s future, ensuring that Cardano remains at the forefront of blockchain technology and education.
